actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3857.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Hurd (CO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3857 — "To amend the Snow Water Supply Forecasting Program Authorization Act."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2293.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Hurd (CO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2293 — "To require the Secretary of the Interior to reissue certain regulations relating to the taking of double-crested cormorants at aquaculture facilities."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 655.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Hurd (CO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 655 — "To direct the Secretary of Agriculture to convey certain Federal land to the City of The Dalles, Oregon."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4285.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4285 — "To direct the Secretary of the Interior to designate an entrance-fee free date in 2026 at National Park Service sites in order to celebrate the 250th anniversary of the United States of America."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1276.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1276 — "To remove restrictions from a parcel of land in Paducah, Kentucky."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2302.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2302 — "To take certain Federal land in the State of California into trust for the benefit of the Shingle Springs Band of Miwok Indians, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 356.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. LaMalfa moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 356 — "To extend the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed S. 2950.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Walberg to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 9.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Brandon Gill to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
